definition: Gu Yanwu (1613-1682), late Ming and early Qing Confucian philosopher, linguist and historian, played a founding role in phonology of early Chinese, author of Rizhilu or Record of daily study 日知錄|日知录
surname Gu
to look after/to take into consideration/to attend to
flame/inflammation/-itis
martial/military
surname Wu

sentences.english: Gu has proposed a series of methods for cultivating the virtue of shame.
sentences.chinese: 顧炎武還提出了一系列培養“恥德”的方法。

sentences.english: His view of shame is of great value for the construction of the contemporary concepts of honor and disgrace.
sentences.chinese: 顧炎武的“恥德”觀對當代榮辱觀建設具有啓示意義。

sentences.english: Thinking much of customs and education was stress of the Guyanwu's etiquette research.
sentences.chinese: 重視風俗教化是顧炎武禮學研究的重點。

definition: Huang Zongxi (1610-1695), scholar and writer of the Ming-Qing transition
